title: Using Apple’s Foundational Models in the Shortcuts App
partialText: Here’s a short but sweet story about quickly getting access to Apple’s Foundational Models without writing a line of code.

title: Running a RAG powered language model on Android using MediaPipe
partialText: A couple of months ago I gave a talk about running on device SLMs in apps. It was well recieved and refreshing to be able to give a talk where mobile apps can gain an advantage from the rise in language model usage.

title: Multiplatform Development for Apple Devices
partialText: In June 2023 as Apple announced the Vision Pro I had an idea that could work well on the headset. A collection of looped videos playing alongside your day to day usage.

title: Getting Setup With Xcode Cloud
partialText: Xcode Cloud is a Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CI / CD) platform provided by Apple. It automates away the hard work of building your apps, testing them, signing them, and pushing them to a destination.

title: Which Map Transformation Should I Use?
partialText: Map transformation functions find common usage in Android development. They are part of the Kotlin Standard Library, a library built by JetBrains to provide standard functionality across Kotlin codebases.

title: Playing Simon Says with Gemma-2b and MediaPipe
partialText: A couple of weeks ago I attended Google’s Gemma Developer Day. A day dedicated to Google presenting the capabilities, portability and openness of their newest LLM models called Gemma.

title: Interacting with Apple Maps Through URL Parameters
partialText: I recently made a change to EVBuddy to update what happens when a user needs directions via Apple Maps.

title: Building EV Buddy
partialText: In the past couple of years I’ve become interested in the cloud. I’ve spent a good chunk of my career working in mobile development, and if theres one trend I don’t think is going away soon is apps powered by a platform. As any good engineer would do, I was keen to learn more.

title: Jetpack Compose for Maps
partialText: This post is based off a talk given at Google I/O Extended for Google Developers Group London in July 2023. The slides for the talk are available here

title: Getting Started With Flutter: Part Three
partialText: This is part three of a series of blog posts about getting started with Flutter. In part two, we used the Flutter plugin to create a new app project, ran the app using an Android Emulator and made use of Flutters’ Hot Reload feature
